Title: Aspects of the Novel.

Thumbnail: http://books.google.com/books/content?id=qWU9PgAACAAJ&printsec=frontcover&img=1&zoom=1&source=gbs_api.
Description: Forster's lively, informed originality and wit have made this book a classic. Avoiding the chronological approach of what he calls "pseudoscholarship," he freely examines aspects all English-language novels have in common: story, people, plot, fantasy, prophecy, pattern, and rhythm.
